fail.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to not succeed in achieving something
fail.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: It looks likely that the peace talks will fail.
Millions of people have tried to quit smoking and failed miserably (=been completely unsuccessful).
his efforts to save his failing marriage
If all else fails, you may be advised to have an operation.
He failed in his attempt to regain the world title.
Doctors failed to save the girl’s life.
fail.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to not do what is expected, needed, or wanted
fail.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The government are failing in their duty to protect people.
Firms that fail to take advantage of the new technology will go out of business.
fail.translation[0].definitions[1].note_: Fail to do something is used mainly in writing and in formal contexts. In everyday English, people usually say do not do something instead:
fail.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to not pass a test or examination
fail.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: I failed my driving test the first time I took it.
He failed maths but passed all his other subjects.
fail.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to decide that someone has not passed a test or examination
fail.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Her work was so bad that I had no choice but to fail her.
fail.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: if a company or business fails, it is unable to continue because of a lack of money
fail.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: if a part of a machine or an organ in your body fails, it stops working
fail.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: The hospital said that his kidneys were failing.
fail.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: if your sight, memory, health etc is failing, it is gradually getting weaker or is not as good as it was
fail.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: Failing eyesight forced him to retire early.
fail.translation[0].definitions[7].defin: if crops fail, they do not grow or produce food, for example because of bad weather
fail.translation[0].definitions[8].defin: if the rains (=a lot of rain that falls at a particular time each year) fail, they do not come when expected or it does not rain enough
fail.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: fail
to not succeed – used about people, plans, methods etc
The plan failed.
They failed to persuade her to change her mind.
This method never fails.
go wrong
if something you do goes wrong, it fails after starting well
The experiment went wrong when the chemicals combined to form a poisonous gas.
not work
if something does not work, it does not do what you want it to do
The drugs don’t work.
I tried to fix it with glue, but that didn’t work.
be unsuccessful
to not have the result you wanted
His first attempt to get a teaching job was unsuccessful.
The search was unsuccessful.
be a failure
to be unsuccessful, with the result that you have wasted your efforts
The government’s 5-year plan to modernize the economy was a complete failure.
backfire
if a plan or action backfires, it does the opposite of what it was intended to do
His plan to get attention backfired, and instead of being promoted he lost his job.
in vain
if you try to do something in vain, you fail to do it
They tried in vain to save him.
All her efforts had been in vain.
fail.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: an unsuccessful result in a test or examination
fail.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: I got a fail in history.
fail.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: an occasion when someone is not successful or does something badly
fail.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: My parenting has included some spectacular fails.
fail.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: used for saying that someone has failed or done something badly
fail.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: if a business fails, it is not successful and loses so much money that it has to close
fail.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: The company failed amid charges that the chairman had stolen $17 million.
More than 10,000 companies failed with debts of more than 10 million yen.
fail.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: if something you try to do fails, it is not successful
fail.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: A move to vote the chairman off the Bell Resources board failed.
A salesman may communicate perfectly well with a customer but fail to make a sale.
fail.translation[3].definitions[2].defin: if something fails to happen, it does not happen, although you expected or wanted it to
fail.translation[3].definitions[2].examp: The new projects have failed to gain general acceptance from the board.
If the recovery fails to cut the deficit sharply, a rise in taxes will be needed.
fail.translation[3].definitions[3].defin: if equipment or a machine fails, it stops working because there is a fault
fail.translation[3].definitions[4].defin: if crops fail, they do not grow or produce any food
fail.translation[3].definitions[4].examp: The corn harvest failed after a terrible drought.
fail.translation[3].definitions[5].defin: to not pass an examination, test or INSPECTION
fail.translation[3].definitions[5].examp: The railway line failed its Board of Trade inspection earlier this year.
